summary:
From 1969 researcher and writer on the history and use of the pipe and the culture of smoking worldwide with the aim of capturing this phenomenon for purposes of study and pleasure.
Founder of museum Pijpenkabinet, now Amsterdam Pipe Museum along Prinsengracht in the centre of Amsterdam.

awards.title: European Heritage Award / Europa Nostra Award
awards.description:
For his long-term study of and commitment to the history of the pipe and the culture of pipe smoking, Don Duco has been granted the prestigious European Heritage Award, or Europa Nostra Award. This is the highest honour in Europe for projects and individuals committed to heritage. Don Duco deserves this recognition for the fifty years that he has worked on the collection of the Amsterdam Pipe Museum and for all the knowledge that he makes public through the online collection database at www.pipemuseum.nl.

"Don Duco is considered to be the expert in his field. He has convincingly positioned the pipe as a mirror of society, a reflection of cultural, social, economic and technological developments in the history of humanity”, said the jury.
awards.issuer: European Commission in coöperation with Europa Nostra

awards.title: Confrère Maître Pipier
awards.description: Elected as member (confrère) in the Confrérie des Maîtres Pipiers in Saint-Claude, Jura, France because of merits for the worldwide promotion of the history of the tobacco pipe.
awards.issuer: Confrérie des Maîtres Pipiers in Saint-Claude, France

awards.title: Pipe Smoker of the Year
awards.description: Elected as Pipe Smoker of the Year based on promotional work for the tobacco pipe as author and founder of the national Dutch pipe museum.
awards.issuer: Stichting Pijp, federation of Dutch pipe smoker's clubs

awards.title: Life memberschip Académie Internationale de la Pipe
awards.description: Successor of Georg A. Brongers, curator of Niemeyer Tobacco Museum, as the Dutch representative in this international group of pipe smokers, researchers and authors on pipes and pipe smoking.
awards.issuer: Académie Internationale de la Pipe, Paris

awards.title: Johan de la Court Prize
awards.description: Award to merit the pioneering research and series of publications on tobacco pipes and the history of smoking.
awards.issuer: Koninklijke Academie van Wetenschappen (Royal Dutch Academy of Science) in Amsterdam

projects.title: Revision handbook on the Dutch clay pipe
projects.description: Reissue of the handbook on the Dutch clay tobacco pipe published in 1987 on a new and more scientific basis with the addition of chapters about the role of the clay tobacco pipe in archeology. Hours: 3,500.

projects.title: Digitizing data Amsterdam Pipe Museum collection
projects.description: Developing a database infrastructure around the different sources of information in the Amsterdam Pipe Museum (former Pijpenkabinet) through a relational database that are supporting resources seamlessly linked to the museum objects. The results incorporated in www.pipemuseum.nl. Hours: 8,000

projects.title: The archeology of the clay pipe
projects.description: In collaboration with the archaeological world (iz city archaeologists and archaeological services) the development of a methodology was worked out to interpret the production, distribution and dissemination including the users of clay tobacco pipes Resulted in a dozen articles about the possibilities of the research and numerous reports of specific sites, the most comprehensive being the report on the city of Alkmaar. Hours: 4,000

projects.title: Opium project
projects.description: Study of printed sources and objects from the collection of the Amsterdam Pipe Museum and from private collections aiming to create a source book. Relevant historical information about opium and opium use available, also including a comprehensive description of the opium pipes and opium paraphernalia. Hours: 3,000.

projects.title: Inventory of the marks of the Gouda pipemakers
projects.description: Since the publication on the Gouda pipe makers marks in 1982, research has been proceeded, resulting in a comprehensive handbook on the subject published in 2003. This research, covering the total municipal archives of the city of Gouda over the period 1600-1900 unveiled the development of the ordinances on copyright issued by the pipe makers guild. Over time these local ordinances transformed into a provincial and later national legislation on mark protection, based on the pipe makers marks. During the research the inventory of pipe makers, their trademarks and period of activity within the guild was finalized, using all sorts of archival sources since the guild records are incomplete. From the museum collectionsover 7,000 specimen of marked pipes were studied, which were connected with the historical data. Part of the publication is an art-historical chapter on the printed wrappers for the wholesale of pipes. The research resulted in a manual that is an important resource for archaeologists and historians, worldwide considered as the standard work. Hours: 6,000.

projects.title: Goedewaagen project
projects.description: Identification and interpretation of the history of the company Goedewaagen from Gouda, working from 1779 to 1982, pipes and pottery manufacturers. Three publications present the general history of the factory, a monograph devoted to the design of clay tobacco pipes and a descriptive genealogy of the family. Hours: 2,500

projects.title: Archival research Streek Archiefdienst Hollands Midden, Gouda
projects.description: Thorough investigation of the clay pipe industry in all its facets. Also part of fourteen weeks of study for young people (NJBG) to learn to work in the public archive. Results are recorded in "Bronnen tot de geschiedenis van de pijpennijverheid in Gouda" (Sources of the history of the pipe industry in Gouda) (Duco, Amsterdam, 1973 et seq.)

projects.title: Royal pipes and their history
projects.description: Research on the value of the clay pipe as promotional item pro the House of Orange including the source of inspiration for this phenomenon. Resulted in an inventory and a public book with general story. Linked to a traveling exhibition on this subject in six Dutch museums (Het Loo, Apeldoorn, Groningen, Hoorn, Leiden, Rotterdam and Breda) and three foreign museums (Wervik, Dillenburg, Vienna). Hours: 2,500

projects.title: Handbook on the Dutch clay tobacco pipe
projects.description: After a thorough product research of the Dutch clay tobacco pipe an handbook is published focussed on shape, brand and decoration. For archaeologists, the deductive identification method was introduced. Awarded by the Dutch Royal Academy of Sciences in 1989.

projects.title: Archival research Dutch clay pipe in 20 Dutch archives
projects.description: Exploratory research into the pipe industry in the Netherlands with special focus on the seventeenth century. Results published in "The Clay Tobacco Pipe Netherlands in the Seventeenth Century" (Oxford, BAR-series, 1981).

publications.name: Century of Change, final florish and ultimate fall of the European Clay pipe
Merken en merkenrecht van de pijpenmakers in Gouda / The pipe-makers in Gouda, their marks and ordinances

Firma P. Goedewaagen & Zoon, Fabrikantencatalogus uit 1906, voorzien van historische inleiding en naamregister / Pipe Catalogue of Goedewaagen from 1906, including historic introduction and extensive nomenclature with descriptions
Koninklijke Goedewaagen (1779-1982), een veelzijdig ceramisch bedrijf / Royal Goedewaagen, a versatile ceramic factory
De tabakspijp als Oranje-propaganda / The Tobacco Pipe as a commemorative Advertisement
De Nederlandse kleipijp, handboek voor dateren en determineren / The Dutch Clay Tobacco Pipe, manual for dating and determination
The clay tobacco pipe in seventeenth century Netherlands

profile_positions.description: Responsable for the acquisition, documentation and collection management of this now leading pipe museum in the world. Researcher and publicist on the history of smoking.
profile_positions.title: museum curator
